hints.content:
There are $\maroonD{4}$ jumps of $\blueD{5}$ units each.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled plus 5. A brace labeled, 4 equal jumps, spans all 4 arrows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0609c04fcf4bf1d8e607a4393205947868638814)

The expression $\maroonD{4} \times \blueD{5}$ represents the number line.

We can reach the same total, $20$, using $\blueD{5}$ jumps of $\maroonD{4}$ units each.

![A number line labeled 0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20. Arrows labeled, plus 4, point right from each number to the next. A brace labeled, 5 equal jumps, spans all 5 arrows.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ce31241e106c7612ed7a6adffaa8f342b9e07218)

The expression $\blueD{5} \times \maroonD{4}$ is equivalent to $\maroonD{4} \times \blueD{5}$.

[[☃ explanation 2]]
We can represent the number line with the expressions $\blueD{5} \times \maroonD{4}$ and $\maroonD{4} \times \blueD{5}$.

question.content:
**Which two expressions represent the following number line?**

![A number line labeled 0, 5, 10, 15, 20. Arrows point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ef9583eb047cccb0a69aef2b5bff214b3914fe36)

[[☃ radio 1]]
